definitions.definition: The act of commemorating; an observance or celebration to honor the memory of some person or event.
That which serves the purpose of commemorating; a memorial .
The specification of individual saints in the prayers for the dead .
The great festival of the Oxford academic year , usually taking place on the third Wednesday after Trinity Sunday .

main_definition: The act of commemorating; an observance or celebration to honor the memory of some person or event.
secondary_definitions: That which serves the purpose of commemorating; a memorial .
( religion ) The specification of individual saints in the prayers for the dead .
( UK ) The great festival of the Oxford academic year , usually taking place on the third Wednesday after Trinity Sunday .
